chemoreception.notes: Ticks in general rely heavily on chemoreception to locate hosts. Given Nuttalliella's tick classification, it is highly likely they possess this sense for host detection.

mechanoreception.notes: Ticks use mechanoreceptors to detect vibrations and physical contact. Although the description mentions a lack of setae, this refers to external bristles - they will still have mechanoreceptors within their cuticle.

hygroreception.notes: Ticks are known to use humidity gradients to locate suitable habitats and hosts.
